column2: A copywriter is a creative professional responsible for producing compelling and persuasive written content for various marketing and advertising materials      They play a crucial role in crafting engaging messages that effectively communicate a brand's message, promote products or services, and engage the target audience        Key Responsibilities:        Content Creation: Develop and write clear, concise, and engaging copy for various marketing and advertising materials, including but not limited to website content, social media posts, blog articles, email campaigns, brochures, and print advertisements      Ensure that the content aligns with the brand's voice, tone, and messaging guidelines      Research and Analysis: Conduct thorough research on the target audience, market trends, competitors, and industry best practices to gather relevant information and insights      Analyze the data to understand consumer preferences, behavior, and needs, and incorporate these findings into the copy to enhance its effectiveness      Brand Messaging: Understand the brand's identity, values, and unique selling propositions      Translate this knowledge into persuasive and consistent messaging that resonates with the target audience and effectively communicates the brand's value proposition      Collaborative Process: Work closely with the marketing team, designers, and other stakeholders to develop integrated marketing campaigns      Collaborate on concept development, brainstorming, and refining ideas to ensure that the copy aligns with the overall campaign objectives      Editing and Proofreading: Review and revise copy to ensure accuracy, clarity, grammar, and adherence to the brand's guidelines      Proofread content for spelling errors and consistency in style and tone      SEO Optimization: Incorporate relevant keywords and optimize copy for search engine optimization (SEO) to improve visibility and organic search rankings      Stay updated on SEO best practices and trends to enhance the effectiveness of written content      Adherence to Deadlines: Manage multiple projects simultaneously and deliver high-quality copy within agreed-upon deadlines      Adapt quickly to changing priorities and project requirements      Continuous Learning: Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and new marketing techniques      Continuously improve writing skills and stay abreast of evolving language styles and cultural references        Qualifications and Skills:        Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Marketing, or a related field (preferred but not mandatory)      Proven experience as a copywriter or in a similar role, preferably in a marketing or advertising agency      Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a keen eye for detail      Strong understanding of marketing principles and ability to translate them into compelling copy      Familiarity with SEO best practices and keyword optimization      Proficiency in using content management systems, project management tools, and other relevant software      Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment      Excellent time management and organizational skills      Creativity, adaptability, and a willingness to embrace feedback and constructive criticism

column2: Technical Content and Quiz WriterBanglore, KA, IndiaAbout Company:ZaranTech is a US based Global IT Training and Consulting Company, which provides focused Individual and Corporate trainings from our Sr. trainers who have 10+ years of experience in the fast paced world of Information Technology. ZaranTech provides Role based training as compared to Product based training methodology.      Most of our training programs are delivered Online and we provide Instructor Led and Self Paced types of training.Job Profile:As a elearning Technical Content Writer, you will do a lot of research and write very unique content based on the training courses we offer and their benefits. After approval of the Article, you will work with the Graphics designer inhouse to develop a picture to go along with the Article.Then you will post it on ZaranTech Blog and Forums (which are public).      You will also be posting this Article on several other popular Article websites with correct keywords and Titles to get them popular. When someone responds to the Forum post or asks a question of the Forum, you will find the answer and post that as well     . 2. Must be familiar with Blog and Forum postings3. Must be familiar with posting these Articles on several other websites and getting them popular with SEO techniques4. Manage all content activities including content for inbound (blog articles, eBooks, infographics, videos about our courses ), marketing collaterals (e - mailers, paid search banners, social media)5. Create a well - defined process flow for developing engaging content, Interact with Subject Matter Experts and trainers for the content approval .6. Post articles on Social media sites for marketing. Work with Graphic Designer to get pictures for every articles7. Must maintain forums where you have to answer questions with the help of in - house SME     Detailed job DescriptionRelevance  -  The articles must provide insights, trends, case studies and discussions on the professional certification domains like Business Analyst, Quality Assurance, Informatica, Salesforce, SAP (HANA, S4HANA Finance and Logistics, SuccessFactors, Fiori and UI5, BW4HANA, FICO), DevOps, Tableau, Big Data Hadoop, Apache Spark Scala, Python and more.Introduction  -  Please provide a brief description of your professional qualifications and interests as wellOriginal  -  Your post must be original, and not previously published online or in print. The content must be 100% unique; should not be copyrighted by any other source. You must agree not to publish it anywhere else, including your own blog or website. You may, however, post a brief "tease" or summary on your site that links to the post on Turning Point.Headings  Must appear natural and relevant to the topic. Use interesting and catchy captions, headings, and subheadings throughout the article.     Value? Ensure the information in the article is well researched and up - to - date. The content must be informative and a valuable resource to the reader as well as our online community.     Paragraphs? If there is a lot of content, break it down into shorter paragraphs to enhance readability and user experience.Flow & Style? The flow and style of the content should be natural and engaging throughout.Article Length  -  The post should be at least 700 words and should not exceed 1200 words.Format  -  The article must be in Word format (.docx/.doc); otherwise it will not be accepted.Images  -  Make sure the attached images are clear and the resolution is 600x350 pixels. In case you are sending a chart/graph, please ensure it is provided only in a .jpeg / .gif / .png format. Images are to be attached separately and not inside the Word document. If necessary, add at least two graphical images or diagrams to explain certain topics. Ensure the images contain concise alternate texts and captions that accurately describe them. ( We may use our own images)     Credits and Sources  -  Remember to include credits and sources used in your post     1. Experience of 2 - 6 yrs in Content writing, blog and forum postings2. Must have excellent Writing skills and worked or knowledge of E - learning industry3. Must have expertise in writing articles for US audience, research based articles, various newsletters, press releases, special articles, etc4. Must have prior experience in writing content for courses related to IT Technology and Elearning industry.

column2: Were looking for a Technical Writer to author, edit, and review product documentation      In this role, you ll work with internal resources, interview software developers, and attend engineering meetings to gather, write, and publish technical information for our varied audiences      You ll produce a variety of top quality learning materials such as technical documentation, infographics, screenshot markups, and training videos      As a successful Technical Writer at APIwiz (Itorix Inc), you re motivated, passionate, and thrive in the fast-paced culture of a dynamic and evolving startup company      You have strong writing skills, the ability to synthesize technical content from an SME and create training materials that clearly explain the topic/task to end users based on their persona      We like to move quickly and win together, so a self-starter who thrives under pressure and enjoys team successes          **Roles Responsibilities*     - Work with product managers, product marketing, and engineers to produce and maintain world-class documentation, including: User Guides, Integration Guides, API Developer Guides, In platform documentation (tooltips, welcome instructions, etc.).      - Prepare, review, revise, and maintain technical documents, including software and systems engineering, system operations, testing, and user documentation.      - Gather and analyze technical and product information from various sources to document new or changing product functionality.      - Write, format, edit, review, and proof procedural and technical information for technical and nontechnical users.      - Assist in planning, scheduling, and tracking documentation work to meet product release dates and client deliverables.      - Maintain a library of application documentation, cataloging it for internal and/or external use.      - Gather customer feedback on documentation to improve usability.      **What we re looking for*     - 3+ years of technical writing experience.      - SaaS experience is preferred.      - Strong written and verbal communications and experience working with content in multiple mediums.      - Experience working cross-departmentally to communicate the nuts and bolts of a product.      - Strong experience owning an end-to-end documentation creation process.      - Excellent attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects in a fast-paced, changing environment.      - Experience working with the following tools preferred: Confluence/JIRA, Git Github, HTML, CSS, Hubspot, JavaScript, Intercom, Gitbook, Markdown.      - A familiarity with API documentation for REST APIs.      - A familiarity with working and experimenting with code samples to better understand the needs of API consumers.      - Experience creating infographics such as diagrams, screenshots, workflows, graphs, etc.      **Minimum Qualifications*     - BA/BS in Technical Communication or related discipline, or at least three years of experience in writing complex documentation for web-based software.      - Portfolio of work and/or writing samples.      - Experience writing content for software applications using a CMS.      - Excellent work ethic and strong intellectual curiosity.

column2: Job Description   We are currently seeking a PMO Manager to work out of our Bangalore,  India office. As the successful candidate,  you willwork as part of a global team. We are looking for driven,  motivated and well organized Project Management Officer (PMO) -  Manager.   Primary Responsibilities    Management of a portfolio of projects    Implementation of a Portfolio Management software    Resource Management    Implement,  support and interface for an internal management reporting framework to effectively accomplish project goals.    Responsible for on/ in- time submission of PMO deliverables.     Managing a team of project controllers/ planners which handles entire project lifecycles: This includes project scoping,  planning,  budgeting,  monitoring,  tracking,  progress reporting,  resource management/ resource allocation and summary of costs incurred.    Set up and manage project support functions covering planning,  tracking,  reporting,  and internal communication.    Maintain and update project plans,  resource availability records,  milestone summary,  key issues,  risks,  benefits.    Coordinating with Project Managers from different geographical locations on a regular basis to facilitate the PMO functions.    Should be able to identify the key performance indicators for reporting and alerting.    Identify avenues to automate PMO processes and implement them with suitable technology tools.     Besides developing and maintaining plans,  the PMO office should communicate and track risk issues associated with planned and committed dates. As part of the planning process,  the PMO should also monitor critical resource levels across functional areas required to support projects.    The PMO should schedule meetings with various teams to collect and communicate project status -  operations,  data quality,  and change management.    Coordinate with the finance controllers/ account administrators to ensure project invoices are accurately prepared and timely submitted.    Analyze and synthesize key project information for Project Managers.    Provide guidance and support to facilitate the accurate set- up,  performance and reporting of projects.    Complete Work Breakdown Structure to estimate effort required for each task.   Desired Skills & Experience:    Hands on experience in implementation of portfolio project.    Should be able to manage the team    Familiarity with S- Curve concept as a tool for monitoring project progress    Proficient in MS Project and Excel.    Manage the Project documentation repositories. BE /  B.

column2: Our Client Tech Process is looking for Middleware Architect & Team Leader  Job Designation: Middleware Architect & Team Leader  Job Location: Mumbai   Experience: 4- 7Years.      Tech Process Payment Services Limited is a dynamic Mumbai- based payment solutions,   software & services company established in year 2000. Our clients are organizations from  diversified sectors.      The Middleware Architect & Team Leader will report to the Development Manager/ Project  Manager and will be accountable for developing and maintaining key integration and  workflow service modules of TPSL software. He or she is also charged with leading a group  of experienced software developers.      The Middleware Architect & Team Leader position will provide technical leadership,   oversight,  standardization and validation of middleware application architecture. Architect will work closely with Project Managers,  Business Analyst and other IT groups; providing  technical leadership for integration efforts involving geographically or otherwise distributed  Enterprise Applications and Integration platform.      The Middleware Architect & Team Leader will work on solutions both internally with the  product and solutions team and externally with the clients IT teams as required. The  candidate must have strong communication skills,  IT analysis,  technical skills,  and work  experience in developing client solutions using application and integration middleware and  associated technologies.      Job Description       Design and deployments of application components that are standards based,  high  performance,  highly available,  comply with operational standards and procedures.   Provide leadership and demonstrate ownership of the integration platform for consistent  usage across projects.   Understand the business and customer needs to introduce technical solutions that grow  the bottom line.   Lead the team for integration/ performance testing based on integration and test plan,   support UAT and make sure that the Application is defect free.   Establish Middleware governance based on best practices and ensure proper alignment  business and major initiatives.   Understand and contribute to Enterprise IT strategies; adhere to compliance regulations  and development guidelines.   Responsible for the architectural review and approval of application designs and  technology selection for projects.   Work closely with Business Analysts and the Product Owner to understand the system s  functional and non- functional requirements   Collaborate with the Product Owner and Development Manager to define the product  vision   Work closely with Technical Analysts and the Development Team to ensure software  architectural integrity   Implement code review and unit test processes   Design,  develop and modify modules based on functional and non- functional requirements   Participate in release and sprint planning   Conduct daily scrum meetings   Assist developers with troubleshooting complex issues   Mentor and guide the developers      Qualifications       Strong hands- on experience with Application Integration architecture,  including Service  Oriented Architecture (SOA) and Messaging Systems.   Working knowledge of various integration design patterns.   Working knowledge of UML and UML design tools (Enterprise Architect)   Hands- on development expertise in MQ,  Java,  JMS,  JDBC,  etc.   Experience building and implementing Enterprise Solutions involving:   Application servers -  JBOSS,  Tomcat,  WebSphere,  WebLogic in cluster  environments   Messaging Systems -  MQ/ MQSeries,  TIBCO RV/ EMS,  JMS,  etc   Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) -  WebSphere ESB,  Oracle ESB,  TIBCO EMS,  etc   SQL and Database Technology -  Oracle,  MySQL,  SQL Server Database   Windows,  Linux & Unix OS -  preferrably AIX in Unix and RHEL for Linux   Knowledge and experience of JUnit and/ or testing methodology.   Strong experience in Web Services standards and technologies (e.g. XML,  SOAP,   WSDL,  XSD,  UDDI,  REST,  etc.).   Maven Build Management   Distributed version control systems (CVS,  VSS,  Mercurial,  Git )   Expertise in Spring Batch,  Spring Integration is a plus.   Expertise in WebSphere Business Integration (WMB/ WBIFN,  WMQ) (SOA Suite) is  required   jBPM is a plus.      Interpersonal skills       Self motivated,  team player,  action and results oriented   Well organized,  good communication and reporting skills   Ability to successfully work under tight project deadlines   Ability to present,  explain and resolve complex problems and escalated issues      Organizational Fit Considerations      TechProcess Payment Services Limited is seeking a team player who enjoys technical  challenges within a fast paced environment,  applies sound judgment in successful task  planning and execution,  meets deadlines,  and communicates the highest standards of  professionalism in his/ her appearance and work habits.  If you have the interest in professional growth and joining a leading Payments Software and  Services company,  it is time to consider joining us !       This is an Immediate Opportunity candidate with less than one month notice will be preferred.  Please ignore this mail if the above profile doesn t match with your current Job Role.

Participate in content analysis, design, and build the learning solutions, pre-release planning to investigate and discuss the latest release changes for several product portfolios.      Write clear and concise chapter narratives and develop real-world and use case-based examples, guided lab exercises      Author all levels of assessments to evaluate learner s skills, knowledge and abilities. Assessments include knowledge checks, quizzes, accreditations, performance-based assessments and legally defensible exams.      Be a valuable team player that interacts with course owners, instructors, and cross-functional work teams, key stakeholders, and subject matter experts to develop course specifications and gather course content.      Ability to schedule meetings, update project matrix/ creating reports with programme/ project management skills.      Classify and collect course survey data to distribute to course owners or simulator teams.      Assist with lab instances support by setting-up data packages of ServiceNow for each release.      Assist with content testing and QA to ensure accuracy and proper function within Now Learning.          Preferred Qualifications:          6+ years of experience building education curriculum and content development with strong instructional design principles.      3+ years of experience participating in customer facing education development projects.      Demonstrated ability to influence and consult (providing options with pros, cons and risks) while providing thought leadership to sponsors/stakeholders in solving training and adoption related issues.      High level of flexibility, creativity and dependability required..      Experience in graphics, templates, icons, and other multimedia throughout the instructional design process and eLearning development.      Demonstrate strong working knowledge of MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint and also eLearning technologies, such as authoring tools (e.g. Articulate 360, Captivate) and design/development tools (e.g., SnagIt, Camtasia, ScreenFlow).      Capability to adapt to a constantly changing environment; flexibility to work extended hours during peak periods if needed, work with Global team, global audience      Experience in rapid development and quick turnaround of training deliverables required and experience in incorporating measurement and assessments into all learning programs a plus.      Good working knowledge of MS Office applications, especially Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, as well as Visio, and, learning technologies such as Captivate, Articulate, design tools, and web conferencing applications required.      Undergraduate or graduate degree in instructional design, education, or organizational development; or equivalent experience

column2: We are seeking a Product Technical Writer to create clear, concise, and comprehensive documentation for our software products. As a Product Technical Writer, you will be responsible for collaborating with our Head of Engineering to gather information about software module , testing procedures, and usage instructions in existing web applications and websites. You will then use that information to create documentation that will serve as training materials and knowledge transfer tools for developers and end-users.          For screening purpose, You need to provide a portfolio of your work, including examples of API documentation you have written           Responsibilities             Create and deliver high quality product technical documentation including user manuals, new feature releases, system operation guides, release notes, integration guides, API content to developers and end-users alike.             Understand complex technical modules and create an organized description of it with easily understandable text and pictures             Work with the leadership team and internal managers to understand the software features and usage             Ensure that documentation is accurate, complete, and up-to-date             Write easy-to-understand user interface text, online help, and developer guides             Prepare documentation that clearly and concisely explains how to use software modules and APIs             Continuously update and maintain the documentation             Skills             Strong technical background     : You should have a strong understanding of the fundamentals of software development process, programming languages, and APIs to inform your technical writing             Writing and editing skills:      You must have excellent writing and editing skills, with the ability to write clear and concise documentation that is easy to understand for developers             Collaboration skills:     You should be able to work collaboratively with software developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to gather information and ensure that the documentation meets the needs of the intended audience             Strong communication skills:      You must have strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively explain complex technical concepts to developers and other stakeholders             Experience             Proven working experience in documenting SaaS applications and software programs from a technical perspective             Experience in writing API Documentation             Experience describing end-user and developer procedures as they relate to the construction and/or use of software modules or applications             Experience with preparing technical documentation of Webapps and mobile apps             Experience with WordPress and custom plugins is a plus

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities As a content developer and designer for strategic IBM data security software products, you will create technical content, both inside and outside of the user interface (UI), with a focus on clarity, accuracy, and the user experience. You will work closely with different IBM teams, including product management, visual design, development, and testing, to deliver clear, inclusive, accessible, and translated content for a global audience. Responsibilities include: Working with design and development teams to make products easier to understand and use. Simplifying technically complex concepts and details from multiple sources into consumable, online documentation. Building technical environments and performing documentation tests to guarantee information accuracy. Collaborating effectively with other writers, designers, and developers to ensure content consistency and quality.  Monitoring content metrics and reader feedback to identify ways to improve published content. Working independently within a global team located across multiple time zones. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Experience creating technical content with standard markup languages, such as DITA and Markdown. Ability to write clearly to convey technical information to target audiences. Aptitude for technology and basic understanding of security software concepts. Excellent English language skills. Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team. Effective communication skills to gather information from subject matter experts in a global environment. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Experience with standard development tools (Jira, GitHub, or equivalents) Experience with version control systems, such as Git. Experience with documentation collaboration tools.

column2: As a Technical Writer, you will be responsible for producing high-quality documentation that effectively communicates technical information related to IT products, software applications, hardware systems, IT processes, and procedures. You will collaborate with IT professionals, software developers, engineers, and other subject matter experts.                       Responsibilities                         ?     Content Creation: Develop clear and concise technical documentation for IT products, systems, and processes. This includes user guides, installation manuals, troubleshooting guides, API documentation, and knowledge base articles.                              Audience Analysis: Understand the target audience, such as end-users, IT administrators, or technical staff, and tailor the language and level of detail in the documentation to meet their needs and proficiency levels.                             Information Gathering: Work closely with IT and software development teams to gather technical specifications, system architecture details, and other relevant information required for documentation.                             Documentation Standards: Ensure that all IT-related documentation adheres to industry standards and internal style guides for consistency, formatting, and terminology.                             User Experience: Focus on user experience by organizing and presenting technical information in an accessible and user-friendly manner.                             Review and Editing: Review, edit, and proofread technical documentation for accuracy, clarity, and completeness.                             Version Control: Maintain version control of documents and update them as IT systems and processes evolve.                             Visual Aids: Create diagrams, flowcharts, screenshots, and other visual aids to enhance the understanding of complex IT concepts.                             Collaboration: Collaborate with IT teams and subject matter experts to understand technical details and accurately convey them in the documentation.                             Documentation Maintenance: Regularly update existing IT documentation to reflect changes and improvements to systems, applications, and processes.                                                 Requirements            Bachelors degree in a relevant field such as Technical Writing, Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent work experience.                        Proven experience as an IT Technical Writer or in a similar role within the IT industry.                       Excellent writing and editing skills with a keen eye for detail.                       Ability to communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and concise manner.                       Familiarity with IT terminology, software development methodologies, and IT infrastructure components.                       Proficiency in using technical writing tools and software like Microsoft Word, MadCap Flare, Confluence.                       Knowledge of documentation best practices, style guides, and industry standards.                       Strong organizational and time management skills to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously.                       Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and build relationships with IT professionals and subject matter experts.

column2: We are currently seeking a Sr. Technical Writer to join our Team. You ll play an integral role in an exciting and fast-paced team where the sky is truly the limit. In this role you will play a crucial part in supporting the team by understanding and documenting the requirements.        Responsibilities      Be an enthusiastic contributor to our growing organization and product engagement efforts. Collaborate as a team to plan upcoming projects but work autonomously to deliver the pieces each member owns.      Review business requirement documents and user stories to plan content.      Maintain index of enhancements/defects from each sprint for Release Notes, for each product.      Receive demonstrations from product team (developers and QA), then spend time on your own to learn the functionality and document configuration and user steps.      Plan, develop, format, write and edit a variety of product content. Examples are below:      Implementation configuration guides      End user guides      Product Release Notes      API documentation      Data flow diagrams      Support department guides          Create forms to be used to collect data from customers during the application setup process.      Research configuration requirements and steps for integration partner platforms.      Become a product expert on the content you create; be comfortable and willing to provide product demonstrations for coworkers and sometimes clients.      Build a comprehensive library of product user documents and implement a methodology for tracking revisions and maintaining version control; serve as a subject matter expert (SME) for our document management system.      While creating documentation, conduct user acceptance testing and provide feedback to delivery via defect or change request logging.      Understand the overall features of the product and possess advanced comprehension of the applications to which you are assigned including their relationship to other applications.      Fully understand the software delivery life cycle and ensure documentation progress within it.      Contribute to special reports, business procedures and knowledge shares as needed.      Occasionally contribute to business and/or technical requirements documents (BRD/TRD).      Establish a project management plan and schedule for gathering content requirements, getting feedback from subject matter experts, setting milestones and hitting due dates; we use Wrike as a project management tool.      Be adaptable to changing priorities and fluctuating workload. Juggle a few different projects in varying stages at once.      Be flexible, as many coworkers work in different time zone. Advanced level MS Office suite knowledge (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)      Able to write in a procedural style for multiple audiences.      Able to document business processes and flowcharts.      Keen interest in technology and the latest digital trends, plus have an aptitude for turning complex ideas into easy-to-understand concepts.      Preferred Knowledge & Skills      B.A. in English, Creative Writing, Computer Science, or related field with excellent verbal and written communication.      Minimum 4-5 years working as a product Writer, preferably from the IT/Software industry      Experience with eCommerce Platforms (Magento, BigCommerce, Shopify) and/or Acumatica ERP Preferred

column2: Job Description: We are looking for a highly skilled IT Technical Writer with pre-sales experience and expertise in crafting compelling white papers to join our team. As an IT Technical Writer, you will play a critical role in creating clear, concise, and comprehensive technical documentation, marketing collateral, and white papers that showcase our products and solutions to potential customers. You will work closely with our product managers, sales teams, and subject matter experts to understand our technology offerings and translate complex technical concepts into easily understandable content for a diverse audience. Responsibilities: Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to gather technical information and insights about our products, features, and solutions. Write and maintain technical documentation, including user guides, API documentation, release notes, and knowledge base articles, to support our customers and internal teams. Create engaging marketing collateral, such as datasheets, case studies, and solution briefs, to highlight the key features and benefits of our products and solutions. Develop comprehensive white papers and technical articles that explore industry trends, best practices, and thought leadership topics related to our technology domain. Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to develop sales enablement materials, including presentations, demo scripts, and product pitch decks, to support pre-sales activities and customer engagements. Conduct research and gather relevant data from internal and external sources to support the creation of compelling content that addresses customer pain points and challenges. Ensure consistency, accuracy, and clarity across all written materials, adhering to established style guidelines and brand standards. Collaborate with graphic designers, illustrators, and multimedia specialists to enhance the visual appeal and effectiveness of technical content and marketing collateral. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape to continuously improve the quality and relevance of our technical documentation and marketing materials. Participate in cross-functional meetings, workshops, and training sessions to share knowledge, gather feedback, and contribute to the overall success of the team. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Technical Writing, English, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). Proven experience (X years) working as a technical writer in the IT industry, with a focus on creating documentation and marketing collateral for software products and solutions. Strong writing and editing skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly and effectively to diverse audiences. Experience in pre-sales activities, including customer presentations, product demonstrations, and solution consulting, is highly desirable. Demonstrated experience in crafting persuasive white papers, technical articles, and thought leadership content that drives engagement and generates leads. Proficiency in using authoring tools and content management systems (e.g., Microsoft Word, Confluence, SharePoint) to create, manage, and publish technical documentation. Familiarity with graphic design principles and multimedia tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Canva) to create visually appealing and engaging content is a plus. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and build positive relationships with stakeholders. A passion for technology, innovation, and continuous learning, with a curiosity to explore new topics and trends in the IT industry.

Conduct research and gather relevant data from internal and external sources to support the creation of compelling content that addresses customer pain points and challenges. Ensure consistency, accuracy, and clarity across all written materials, adhering to established style guidelines and brand standards. Collaborate with graphic designers, illustrators, and multimedia specialists to enhance the visual appeal and effectiveness of technical content and marketing collateral. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape to continuously improve the quality and relevance of our technical documentation and marketing materials. Participate in cross-functional meetings, workshops, and training sessions to share knowledge, gather feedback, and contribute to the overall success of the team. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Technical Writing, English, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). Proven experience (X years) working as a technical writer in the IT industry, with a focus on creating documentation and marketing collateral for software products and solutions. Strong writing and editing skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly and effectively to diverse audiences. Experience in pre-sales activities, including customer presentations, product demonstrations, and solution consulting, is highly desirable. Demonstrated experience in crafting persuasive white papers, technical articles, and thought leadership content that drives engagement and generates leads. Proficiency in using authoring tools and content management systems (e.g., Microsoft Word, Confluence, SharePoint) to create, manage, and publish technical documentation. Familiarity with graphic design principles and multimedia tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Canva) to create visually appealing and engaging content is a plus. Excellent project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and build positive relationships with stakeholders. A passion for technology, innovation, and continuous learning, with a curiosity to explore new topics and trends in the IT industry.

column2: Do you want to help solve the worlds most pressing challengesFeeding the worlds growing population and slowing climate change are two of the worlds greatest challenges. AGCO is a part of the solution! Join us to make your contribution.                 AGCO is looking to hire candidates for the position of Senior Technical Information Specialist.                 The key responsibility of the Sr. Technical Information Specialist will be to create and support content creation including the authoring and review of technical information. Technical Information includes Workshop Manuals, Operators Manuals, Service Bulletins, Assembly Instructions, Knowledge Objects, Schematics and more.                 The creation of this information will initially be in Simplified Technical English (STE) and then translated through our partners to required languages to support the global business of AGCO. This will include creation of Annotated Topic Lists (ATL), identification of re-use topics, collating and checking information from various stakeholders.                 A large part of the role is working with the various stakeholders (Engineering, Product Management, Marketing, etc.) to gather and develop the technical information. This includes information within engineering systems, technical data, CAD, marketing information etc. and where appropriate updating/inputting information in project management and content management systems. Attention to detail is critical as the validity and completeness of this information is crucial to the effectiveness and success in this role.                 Following projects from conception through completion in the AGCO Major Product Introduction Process (AMPIP) and through the product lifecycle will be required to ensure any Engineering Change Notifications (ECNs) are noted, the ATL updated if needed and the changes are updated in the relevant documents.                 Technical review of the content in collaboration with the relevant stakeholders to ensure the technical accuracy will also be the Technical Information Specialists responsibility before signing off to allow topics/chapters to go forward to translation/publication.                 Initiate workflow to release technical information in AGCO Digital Tools with Global Release Team (GRT). Ensure the released information is available and correctly displayed in the relevant digital tools and print shops.                 The scope of the work is to develop information for the Agricultural Products, modules / components or Digital Products as assigned. There will also be process responsibility in support of the Global teams. A Customer first and Digital first mindset is required.                         Your Impact                     Develop - Operators Manual (OM) and its Annotated Topic List (ATL), Workshop Manual (WSM) and its Annotated Topic List (ATL), and Assembly Instruction (AI) and its Annotated Topic List (ATL).                 Access Engineering Systems and gather material for content creation.                 Update ATLs if information is insufficient.                 Translate ECNs into publication comments and update ATLs.                 Publish and distributed P2 drafts per AMPIP project and local requirements (OM, WSM, FCT, AI).                 Deliver the P2 document drafts to the required parties, drives, folders, etc.                 Review the drafts created/modified by peers.                 Deliver the content to AGCO GRT Team for Quality Control check 1.                 Review the Quality Control output report from AGCO GRT team.                 Rework on the content based on the AGCO GRT Team s feedback, if necessary.                 Update ATL for latest known translation requirements.                 Global Process support for other Tech Information teams.                     Your Experience and Qualifications                     Bachelor s degree in Engineering(Mechanical / Automobile) with 10+ years experience in Technical Writing, preferably in Automotive Domain.                 Experience in area of Technical Publication, Service, Training, and Project Management in Agricultural or Industrial Machinery etc.                 Familiar with the products like Tractor, Combine Harvester, Balers, Sprayers etc. would be an added advantage.                 Experience in tier down activities of agricultural or any other equipment and hands-on experience in servicing the equipment would be an added advantage.                 Proficiency with automobile parts/components.                 Experience working with electrical schematics.                 Excellent organization, communication, and interpersonal skills. Strong initiative and follow-through. Handling/addressing customer concerns.                 Working experience/understanding of workflow in ADO or Jira.                 Added Advantage - Certification in Technical Writing, Project Management.                 Software / Tools Experience

column2: We are looking for a    Senior Technical Writer    on the product documentation team at Automation Anywhere, who will develop content that helps our customers, partners, and employees better understand how to configure and use our products to solve their business needs.         The ideal candidate is empathetic to user needs, passionate about improving user experience, has excellent communication (written and verbal) skills, a hands-on approach to exploring new technologies, attention to detail, self-motivated, and thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.         RESPONSIBILITIES   :     The responsibilities and duties of this role include, but are not limited to:       Develop customer-facing product documentation for a product area.     Collaborate with other writers, engineers, product managers, designers, and peers in the support, training, and professional services teams to build user-centric product content (help articles, in-product contextual assistance, and videos) for relevant user personas.     Assimilate and organize a large amount of technical information into targeted formats that users can easily find and apply.     Improve the accuracy, consistency, and quality of existing customer-facing product content.     Gather and analyze feedback from customers, partners, and internal stakeholders to support business process and content improvements.     Contribute to multiple projects simultaneously, potentially manage projects, when needed.     Remain current with trends to recommend enhancements to standards, processes, and tools.     Use critical thinking and problem-solving skills to build just the right amount of content to present at the right time and place to the user.         QUALIFICATIONS         BS/BA in English, Communications, Business, Engineering, or related field is required (or equivalent work experience).     5 - 8 years of hands-on experience creating content in U.S. English for technology products and solutions.     Preferred experience in Enterprise and/or SaaS environments.     Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills.     Knowledge of DITA and structured authoring. Experience with XML-based authoring tools like Oxygen and XMetal.     Experience with one or more of the following systems: DITA-compatible version-control systems, such as Ixiasoft, Heretto, or Git.      Experience with video capturing software, like Captivate or Camtasia, is preferred.     Demonstrated commitment to excellence and high-quality standards.

column2: Dear Candidate, Greeting from Binary Semantics Ltd.!! Get to know us- We are a global company with a range of Value-driven Products, Solutions, Services and Experiences encompassing SaaS, PaaS broadly XaaS, Hybrid and Enterprise.  We firmly believe that the experiential world of tomorrow is going to be interconnected with APIs and Microservices enabling the transformation of Customer Experiences.  We provide Fixed, Subscription or usage-based Pricing Models giving customers choice and value drivers suited to their context/ scenarios.  The list of our gold and silver partners and alliances includes Maplesoft, SAS, Microsoft, Oracle and more. How we bring change:   We leverage our strong technology expertise and deep industry knowledge coupled with focus on customer experience for XaaS like  Insurance Distribution & Aggregation  IoT and vehicle telematics  GST Return filing and Invoicing  Reconciliation of Returns filed  E-way Bill  e-Invoicing  Mobile Workforce  Logistics Process Automation  Consignment Tracking  High-Value Goods Security  Fuel Management  Employee Transport Management  Analytics and BI (Business Intelligence) Our XaaS based Products and productised services ecosystem brings transformational changes in several industry areas by optimization of resources, costs, and processes.  Position  Technical Content Writer Location - Gurgaon Experience  5-9 years Education   Graduation in technical stream Salary   No bar for right candidate. Your Role:    As the Content writer, you will be tasked with write original copy and content across different formats (web, video, social media, ads) to drive growth and scaling up online brand presence of BSL & its subsidiaries (VISOF, DAG, FleetRobo, GSTRobo) .  Create and deliver engaging marketing communications by research, co-ordination, and relevant Industry knowledge. What you will do:   Research industry-related topics (combining online sources, interviews and studies)  In-depth understanding of target profile and come up with engaging content for the defined personas.  Develop, organize, and write eBooks, blogs, case studies, social media content, newsletters and any other relevant marketing content by gathering information from subject matter experts, analysts, and secondary research.  Identify customers??needs and gaps in our content and recommend new topics  Creating and editing original copy that is accurate, well-researched, meets marketing teams' needs and deadlines.  Focused on synthesizing and explaining complex topics. Evoke emotion creating action and generating demand.  Work collaboratively with the content team, graphic designers, analysts, and Subject Matter experts.  Evaluate content and develop improvements. Prepare well-structured drafts using Content Management Systems  Proofread and edit blog posts before its publication. Ensure all-around consistency (style, fonts, images and tone)  Update website content as and when required.  Research and recommend usage of images, lists, charts, infographics, and headings to increase usability and enhance content.  Use of creative hashtags for targeting the trending keywords in sync with brand SOP  Assist the social media team in creating and publishing content  Maintaining a consistent and cohesive brand personality throughout all content. Beyond (How you will grow and what more you can do):   Take responsibility- Learn new skills, grow as a person and a professional, inculcate skills and Learnings in yourself and others.  Realize your Capabilities & Potentials- take ownership and build synergies to collaborate and help everyone around you.  Be involved, come up with innovative ideas, and takes initiative.  Master the art of persuasion and write compelling stories that attract participants to our programs  Continually raise the bar on creativity, writing fresh copy that connects with the desired audience and drives action The skills you need to bring along-   5+ years of B2B writing experience preferred  Degree (B.Tech/M.Tech) in marketing, business or communication is required  Technology knowledge of B2B software space is must   Strong written and verbal communication skills  Skilled in writing and editing content with attention to detail and timelines  Demonstrated aptitude for acquiring and comprehending complex material and topics.  A teamwork attitude, willing to take on extra tasks and see them through. Interested candidate can share their resume on my mail id: richa.chauhan@binarysemantics.com

column2: Engineering Support Office (ESO) supports project engineers by developing and      maintaining      documentation, technical software, and tooling for our engineering department. The project engineers of Vanderlande use an in      -      house developed application (      ESoT      ) to design our systems in the most efficient way. In our tooling      ,      the 3D          layouts are built by use of our system configurator. By choosing the applicable components for the solution and configuring these, the bill of material is generated and send over to the ERP system to trigger our supply process. Besides that, the system design is the starting point for generating our low-level controls software in our PLC coding. The ESO          content team builds the configurable building blocks with all their functionalities.                                                                  ?         Your position:                      Within the ESO          content team      ,      the content engineer guides the design process for the digital building blocks. He/she uses the documentation provided by technology and gathers the user requirements to merge those into a 3D-configurable building block.              Conflicting requirements, automation and intuitive usage are challenges that you will be confronted with. It is up to      you,      to deliver the best result in your content. The building blocks you make are bundled in a library that is periodically      released,          and      you      need to          maintain      th      ose      already released building blocks      .                He/she will      be      responsible for      developing and      maintaining      the digital building blocks that are used in our engineering software. These blocks      represent      both visually and control engineering products Vanderlande uses in its systems.                  This software package supports the various engineering departments around the world in drawing and configuring newly designed systems. column2: As a    Content Associate   , you will be crucial in shaping how our users interact with and understand our products. You will be responsible for creating a wide range of technical and marketing content that educates and engages our target audience. Your work will include developing technical documentation, product marketing collaterals, and product enablement content. This role is a unique opportunity to grow into a subject matter expert or content specialist while working on diverse content creation projects.         A Day in the Life         Develop concise technical documentation for end-users, including user guides, release notes, and how-to videos.     Utilize digital adoption platforms such as WalkMe to create interactive product tours that enhance user experience and product understanding.     Craft compelling product marketing materials, such as whitepapers, blogs, FAQ sheets, and other collateral, to support our marketing efforts.     Create comprehensive product enablement content, including training guides, enablement decks, and sales pitch decks, to support our sales and customer success teams.     Collaborate with product managers, engineers, sales teams, and customer success teams to gather information and ensure the accuracy and effectiveness of content.     Participate in content strategy planning to ensure alignment with company goals and user needs.          Your work will enable all of these:         Elevating Product Usability and Customer Satisfaction: Produce premium documentation and engaging marketing materials that improve user experience and satisfaction, making our products more intuitive and accessible.     Maintaining Documentation and Marketing Excellence: Ensure that all technical documentation and product marketing collaterals are meticulously accurate and current, supporting the seamless introduction of new products and updates.     Promoting Team Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing: Act as a linchpin for knowledge exchange within the company, enhancing synergy between product managers, developers, marketing, sales teams, and other stakeholders through clear, coherent documentation and compelling marketing narratives.     Boosting Customer Success and Product Adoption: Create content that simplifies the learning process and enhances product adoption, including training guides, enablement decks, and sales pitch materials, contributing to the overall success of our customers.         What You Need         0-2 years of experience in content creation, technical writing, or a similar role. Fresh graduates with relevant internships or project experience are welcome to apply.     Familiarity with HTML/CSS, digital adoption tools like WalkMe, and multimedia content creation tools is a plus.     Experience with documentation tools like Confluence and knowledge-base software like Helpjuice is a plus.     Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a keen eye for detail.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.     Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

column2: Who We Are:   Base8 provides technology and business consulting services to companies throughout the US and Canada under the XOverture, Cure8, and Forte brands. We like to work with businesses that are serious about scaling, risk management, and developing mature processes  ones that are looking for a modern, sophisticated, trustworthy, friendly, high-quality (yet still affordable) technology and business partner.   Who You Are:   This position will be Remote, but you will be working closely with the United States and Canada teams through video chat, instant messaging, e-mail, phone, and our software. It is essential that you have excellent communication skills in English, both written and oral. We are a fast-paced company expanding rapidly, and we are seeking team members who will share our vision for the future and work collaboratively to accomplish Base8's goals. We pride ourselves on providing superior service to our clients, which includes attention to detail, following the processes in place, and being able to adapt to various situations.   Job Overview:   We are seeking an experienced?Process Writer with expertise in writing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to join our team. As a?Process Writer, you will be responsible for creating clear, concise, and comprehensive SOPs that effectively communicate complex technical processes and procedures to our internal teams.  Responsibilities:   Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of our organization's products, services, and technical processes.  Collaborate with subject matter experts (SMEs) and cross-functional teams to gather information and understand the intricacies of various processes and procedures.  Write, edit, and format detailed SOPs, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and adherence to company guidelines and standards.  Translate complex technical information into easily understandable language suitable for our target audience.  Organize and structure information effectively, using headings, subheadings, tables, and other formatting techniques to enhance readability and accessibility.  Conduct comprehensive research and analysis to gather necessary information and ensure the accuracy and validity of the content.  Revise and update existing SOPs as needed to reflect changes in processes, procedures, or regulatory requirements.  Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that SOPs meet their requirements and address any feedback or concerns.  Work closely with other teams, such as quality assurance, compliance, and operations, to ensure SOPs align with company policies and regulatory standards.  Review and validate SOPs to ensure they comply with relevant regulations, industry standards, and best practices.  Maintain documentation version control and ensure proper archiving and retrieval of SOPs.  Continuously improve the quality and effectiveness of SOPs by soliciting feedback, conducting audits, and implementing improvements based on best practices.  Requirements:   Bachelor's degree in technical writing, communications, English, or a related field.  Proven experience as a Process Writer/Technical Writer, with a focus on writing SOPs.  Strong knowledge and understanding of technical writing principles, practices, and industry standards.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical information in a clear and concise manner.  Proficiency in using documentation tools such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and Adobe Acrobat.  Familiarity with document version control systems and content management systems.  Attention to detail and the ability to ensure accuracy and consistency in all written materials.  Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.  Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and subject matter experts.  Experience in regulated industries (IT)?is highly desirable.  Knowledge of regulatory requirements, such as ISO standards, FDA guidelines, or other industry-specific regulations, is a plus.  Portfolio or writing samples demonstrating proficiency in writing SOPs are preferred.  Join our team and contribute to the success of our organization by creating high-quality SOPs that enhance operational efficiency, ensure regulatory compliance, and promote consistent and standardized processes across our organization.
column11: US Process, SOP, SME, Technical Writing, Reasearch, Information Technology

column2: Role & responsibilities     Job Brief- We are seeking a talented Technical Content Writer to join our team and contribute to our growing presence in the cryptocurrency industry. As a Technical Content Writer, you will be responsible for creating engaging and informative content that educates our audience about various aspects of cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating clear, concise, and engaging content that appeals to both our technical and non-technical audience. Responsibilities- 1. Research and stay updated on the latest trends, developments, and news in the cryptocurrency and blockchain space. 2. Produce high-quality written content including articles, blog posts, whitepapers, technical documentation, news articles and social media posts. 3. Translate complex technical concepts into clear and easy-to-understand content for both technical and non-technical audiences. 4. Collaborate with the internal teams to develop content strategies and ensure consistency across all platforms. 5. Manage content calendar and ensure timely delivery of assignments. Preferred candidate profile     1. Proven experience as a Technical Content Writer or similar role. 2. Good understanding of cryptocurrency and blockchain technology is a must. 3. Strong research and writing skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts in simple terms. 4. Familiarity with SEO and content management systems. 5. Ability to work independently and manage multiple assignments. 6. Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality. Perks and benefits   You get a chance to work in one of the fastest-growing industries of Blockchain. You get to learn and grow faster with good talented people. Work from home and flexible timing. Also, get additional services like a Netflix subscription, an Udemy course, and a free Zomato food coupon every month. Education Qualification: This role is open to everyone. We value the skills and abilities of each person. Job location: We're looking for someone who is willing to work remotely and has flexible timing. You can work according to your preferences, but we expect dedication from your side. Joining: Immediate, Salary: 15- 20k for first 3 month, then negotiable.

column2: The role is based in the Pune R&D Center, at SAS R&D Pune facility. The candidate will work as a technical writer to document products that cater to domains such as customer intelligence, retail, and banking.             As a technical writer, the candidate will be responsible for designing and developing information that describes the capabilities of SAS software and shows how to use the software to achieve business goals.              Here are the primary responsibilities of the role:           Create deliverables that address the needs and preferences of the target audience for a given SAS product or offering.         Follow company guidelines (such as those for Global English or Accessibility) to provide a good experience for all customers.         Engage with the product development team and a senior technical writer to work on assigned documentation projects.           Furthermore, you will be joining a friendly team with a broad range of cross skills and experience.               Essential Technology Experience:             Ability to develop information that is clear and concise and to apply standard rules of grammar and usage.         Knowledge of business or industry lexicon appropriate to assignments.         Ability to develop examples that demonstrate understanding of software products and business domains appropriate to assignments.         Ability to use the tooling and technical environments associated with developing and testing software products.         Ability to use tools required to develop information and produce customer-facing deliverables.         Ability to work as a team member.         Good organizational and creative problem-solving skills.         Strong understanding of technical writing concepts         Structured authoring         Agile documentation development         Global English guidelines         Minimalism                     Experience of these items would be useful:             XML-based content management system         Oxygen Editor         Acrolinx         Adobe Acrobat Professional         SnagIt         Camtasia Studio               We are a friendly team, and we ll be offering you plenty of opportunities to develop your career. Interested? Then please get in touch to find out more!                Primary Responsibilities             Design and develop deliverables in the form of product documentation as determined by the needs and preferences of the target audience.         Develop clear, accurate and concise information, following all guidelines consistently and effectively. Guidelines include standard rules of grammar and usage as well as corporate guidelines in the form of content models, style guidelines, and editorial guidelines.         Consult with a senior technical writer in the technical publications team and develop documentation based on the guidance provided.                 CANDIDATE PROFILE              Background and Experience           SAS is seeking an associate-level technical writer who has a completed a course in technical writing and has excellent written and verbal communication skills. The candidate must have a bachelor s degree in a communications field or a technical or quantitative field. Candidates with an experience of about a year in technical writing can be an added advantage.             As a technical writer, the candidate must demonstrate these capabilities:           Design and develop information that describes the capabilities of SAS software and shows how to use the software to achieve business goals.          Create deliverables that address the needs and preferences of the target audience for a given SAS product or offering.          Follow company guidelines (such as those for Global English or Accessibility) to provide a good experience for all customers.          Engage with product development teams to contribute to overall software quality and customer satisfaction.         Network with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise.         Receive little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on assignments from a senior technical writer or the documentation manager.

column2: As a Reporting Specialist at Anaqua, you will drive accurate identification and completion of reporting requirements across a number of different functional areas from IP including portfolio management, prosecution management, KPis, finance.         The successful Reporting Specialist will be very detail-oriented, resourceful, and passionately curious.          You should be excited by figuring out how things work, running though analytics, improving, and creating dashboard and reports that enable our customers to understand and make the best use of their data.          Your goal will be to reduce implementation time when on-boarding new clients and increase client satisfaction, working with all the functional areas and identifying opportunities for improvement, anticipating customer needs, and fielding internal requests.         You will need also to document the reports      clearly, concisely, and accurately, and without relying on jargon.                What you will do                In this role, we expect you to           Develop a deep understanding of our product as well as the IP business and be able to identify data to extract to produce requested reports and dashboards.     Own the report-building process for Anaqua from start to finish.      Test, validate and document any deliverable, to make it understandable to customers and Anaqua team.      Collaborate with the rest of the Anaqua team to iterate on report building based on feedback.        Collaborate and Connect.    Work with developers, customers, and cross-functional teams to understand our customer needs and goals.          Produce engaging reports and dashboards that helps people to quickly solve their issues.          Ship content in-step with rapid release cycles, and to a global audience.            Collaborate with Engineers, Product Managers, Business and Technical Consultants, Client Directors and Support members.              Identify user needs, use cases and metrics to focus priorities.              Who you are             Educated. B.tech, M.tech (preferred).             Skilled Communicator.    We are looking for candidates who have excellent analytic skills, writing, and communication skills. You are passionate about learning new skills and concepts and are excited by cutting-edge technology.        Technical.    In this role, you will need to understand requirements, data architecture and extract that data to provide reports and dashboards.      You love learning new tools and pushing the boundaries to provide the best service. You will blaze the trail for users by using all Anaqua solutions capabilities to create reports that delights our customers.        Curious.    You are a problem solver. You have an inquisitive mind and you re not afraid to use it. You know when to ask questions, which questions to ask, and how to listen with intent to learn.        People-friendly.    You work easily with other consultants, client directors, developers, and, of course, with customers.        Hands on.    Your typical approach to figuring out how something works is to try it and see.        Creative.    You are constantly thinking about the shortest distance between the problem and the solution, and you are able to convey that in a meaningful way.        Independent.    You like to figure out what is needed and then get to work!        You are a Recruiter!    Anaqua hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!            POSITION REQUIREMENTS              The ideal candidate must be a passionate, high-energy, strategic, and technically savvy executive leader possessing a strong sense of urgency with a performance-based track record of success. column2: The Technical Writer is a critical role within Application Services that is responsible for driving clear communication of complex technical concepts and solutions as part of contract deliverables, white papers, and proposal responses.                 The Technical Writer?? audience includes inte   al (WWT) and exte   al clients, potential clients, and partners. The Technical Writer will work to attain a level of knowledge and understanding about the solutions that WWT develops and offers, which will allow them to create content such as articles, case studies, white papers, product or service descriptions, website and blog content, presentations, and other media as needed. This position also supports engineers and delivery teams by developing new documentation for contract deliverables and proposals. The Technical Writer may also be responsible for editing, posting, and updating existing content.                 The Technical Writer will drive standardization and reduce the time needed to produce quality documentation. If you love to work in a collaborative environment where continuous lea   ing is encouraged, and you enjoy communicating technical concepts and solutions, this is the position for you!                 The Technical Writer reports to a Software Engineering Manager in Application Services.                   Job Responsibilities/Essential Functions/Competencies             Create original content and/or compile and transition existing content for a variety of stakeholders and audiences across different types of media         Work directly with inte   al and exte   al technical subject matter experts to validate solution details for multiple technologies and coalesce the intended message         Observe and collaborate with end users/exte   al customers to improve the quality of products, services, and documentation provided by delivery teams for existing solutions and processes                       Lead the coordination of blending      input from multiple contributors into a single document, report, or deliverable suitable for customer consumption           Work independently and autonomously to strategize, synthesize write, edit, and proofread content for past performance narratives, capabilities and services papers, white papers, case studies, and other solution studies         Ensure content adheres to defined scope, specifications, and context in accordance with customer expectations and that all content adheres to WWT?? standards for quality, graphics, format, and style         Conduct independent research and analysis on a technical subject to create technical documentation or other forms of communication         Prepare and edit ad-hoc technical documentation, including user manuals, training materials, installation guides, design documents, and reports         Develop or enhance standard documentation templates and processes         May work directly with exte   al customers or as an embedded team member to provide them with documentation and support         Respond to requests from supported business units to author requests for proposal (RFP) responses, case studies, white papers, or other similar documents for new client acquisition, or to promote continued growth and retention of existing client relationships                     Qualifications                   Qualifications include:           Bachelor?? degree required         Excellent verbal and written communication skills         Exceptional interviewing, writing, editing, and proofreading skills         Experience delivering technical documentation (4-6 years)         Strong attention to detail and organizational skills         Demonstrated creative problem solving/analytical skills and ability to prioritize work effectively in a deadline-driven and multi-project environment             Ability to      give and receive feedback     . A central part of living our core values is our environment of safe, timely, and direct feedback. We require and coach our employees on how to provide constructive and critical feedback to their peers, reports, and leadership. This can take on many forms: written, verbal, in a group setting, and one-on-one. Feedback can involve topics ranging from job performance and leadership effectiveness to root cause analysis, communication, and integrity. While not always comfortable, we see the ability to give and receive feedback in a safe environment as a job requirement common across all practices and roles, and a vital aspect of our culture and continuous improvement.         Possesses a high level of      integrity, behaves in an ethical manner that is above reproach.      Builds trust through honesty, reliability, and authenticity by meeting commitments and keeping promises. Possesses a strong conce   for the needs of colleagues and adopts tough, principled stands, even if they??e unpopular.          Demonstrates      self-control     . Manages impulsive feelings and distressing emotions and operates without any personal agenda. Stays composed, positive, and unflappable even in trying moments. Thinks clearly and stays composed and focused under pressure.         Must be      flexible.     Smoothly handles multiple demands, shifting priorities, and rapid change. Works collaboratively to get things done. Proactively seeks the advice and suggestions of peers, subordinates, and superiors. Adapts strategies and tactics to fit fluid circumstances.         Is      optimistic.     Demonstrates a positive mental attitude. Persists in seeking goals despite obstacles and setbacks. Operates from a hope of success rather than a fear of failure. Sees setbacks as due to manageable circumstances rather than a personal flaw.         Models     leadership      qualities. Articulates and arouses enthusiasm for a shared vision and mission. Leads by example.         Fosters     excellence in communication.     Is effective in give-and-take, registering emotional cues in attuning their message. Deals with difficult issues head-on. Listens well, seeks mutual understanding, embraces and participates in the sharing of information. Fosters open communication and is equally receptive to receiving both bad and good news.                      When This Role Is Done Well                       Project documentation deliverables are centrally managed by the Technical Writer, are on-time, require minimal rework, and represent a quality product suitable for customer consumption                     Collaboration exists between the Technical Writer and the delivery and sales teams                     Documentation requiring content from multiple contributors is collaboratively assembled under the direction of the Technical Writer with appropriate deadlines established for content, is presented in a consistent format, and reads as one voice                     Project documentation templates exist for common deliverables such as assessment reports and proposals
