column1: Media & Graphics Design Senior Analyst - Learning Content Design
column2: Media & Graphics Design Senior Analyst - Learning Content Design and Development Skill required:Learning Content Design and Development - Learning Content Development  Designation:Management Level - Senior Analyst  Job Location:Mumbai  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:5 to 8 years  What would you do? The Media / Graphics Senior Analyst provides graphics production or audio and video elements for training assets or other Accenture projects. The Media / Graphics Senior Analyst designs and creates original material using basic elements of graphic design and media development typically creating moderately complex assets. The job requires a low level of supervision. Media / Graphics Senior Analysts may specialize in graphics or media and are not necessarily skilled in both areas. The Learning Content Development team focuses on developing learning activities and supporting materials (for instructor-led training, web-based training, application simulations and performance simulation) according to the content design plan. The team is responsible for creating content for e-learning modules, developing training solutions using prescribed tools, quality, budget and milestone standards. The team is also responsible for participating in course test activities such as cycle testing, UAT, editorial and instructional design checks to properly document problems for issue resolution.  What are we looking for? Ability to establish strong client relationship  Results orientation Education:  Bachelors degree preferred in Communications, Radio and Television, Video/Film Production, Multimedia Design and Production, Art, Fine Arts, Electronic Arts related field or equivalent experience. Work Experience:  6-12 months or hands on experience with audio/video production, Photoshop, Illustrator, and/or Flash  Strong understanding of audio and video production processes.  Working knowledge of media development hardware (e.g. camera operation, lighting, set design)  Knowledge of software production tools (i.e., Adobe Premiere; Adobe After Effects, Soundforge)  Strong understanding of media design Graphics  Proficient in graphic production on the Windows operating system.  Solid visual design skills (color, composition, typography, etc.) for on-line (internet) delivery and print.  Proficient in use of industry standard graphics software (e.g., Photoshop, Dreamweaver, Illustrator, etc.)  Basic ability to estimate design and development time for specific tasks. Roles and Responsibilities Media  Perform basic audio and/or video production for training assets &/or highly visible projects for Accenture and its leadership (i.e. Accenture Partner meeting videos)  Coordinate pre-production, production, and post-production activities (resource and project planning, talent screening and selection, video shoots, etc.)  Produce and direct simple to moderately complex audio and video components  Capture, edit, and compress simple digital audio and video.  Operate production and post-production equipment, hardware, and software  Maintain media equipment  Setup and tear down video and audio equipment for shoots  Perform Quality Assurance on media deliverables based on CDC media and graphics standards and provide feedback to team/media developers  Participates in usability testing and product correction  Participates in efforts to correct, enhance, tailor and upgrade existing courses  Participate in continuous improvement initiatives.  Participates in usability testing and product correction  Participates in efforts to correct, enhance, tailor and upgrade existing training assets  Assists in issue resolution by utilizing all support resources available  Complete repetitive media tasks (i.e., editing video, digitizing audio and video clips, reviewing scripts, burning CDs)  Assists in issue resolution by utilizing all support resources available  Provides regular status to Media Lead and escalates issues as necessary

column2: Key Responsibilities : - Develop and maintain technical documentation including user guides, system manuals, API documentation, troubleshooting guides, release notes, and knowledge base articles. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather information and understand technical concepts, ensuring accurate and comprehensive documentation. - Translate technical information into clear and concise language suitable for different audiences, including end-users, administrators, and developers. - Organize and structure content effectively to enhance readability and usability, employing appropriate formatting, diagrams, and screenshots as needed. - Review and edit documentation to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to style guidelines and industry best practices. - Keep abreast of industry trends, product updates, and changes in technology to continually improve documentation and maintain relevance. - Work closely with product managers, developers, and quality assurance teams to ensure documentation aligns with product functionality and specifications. - Participate in documentation planning, prioritization, and scheduling activities to meet project deadlines and deliver high-quality documentation on time. - Assist in the creation and maintenance of templates, style guides, and documentation standards to promote consistency and efficiency across the organization. - Provide training and support to internal teams and stakeholders on using and understanding technical documentation effectively. Qualifications : - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Technical Communication, or a related field. - Proven experience as a technical writer in the IT industry, with a portfolio demonstrating a strong command of technical writing and documentation skills. - Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical information clearly and effectively. - Proficiency in using documentation tools such as Microsoft Word, Adobe Acrobat, Markdown, and version control systems (e.g., Git). - Familiarity with software development methodologies, APIs, databases, networking concepts, and other IT related technologies. - Attention to detail and a commitment to producing accurate, high-quality documentation. - Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and work effectively in a fast-paced environment. - Experience working in agile development environments and collaborating with cross-functional teams is preferred. - Knowledge of industry standards and best practices for technical writing, such as DITA, Plain Language, and accessibility guidelines, is a plus. - Certification in technical writing or related fields is desirable but not required.

column2: General Manager - Content and Operations Experience: Minimum 20 years in content management, operations, or related field Overview: As the General Manager of Content and Operations at Alliance University Online, you will serve as a visionary leader guiding strategic direction and oversight for the university's content management and operational functions. Your role will be instrumental in driving success through your expertise in content development, operations management, and team leadership. We are seeking a dynamic individual with a demonstrated track record of achievement in these areas to lead our organization to new heights of excellence and innovation. Key Responsibilities: 1. Content Strategy: Develop and implement a comprehensive content strategy aligned with the university's mission, vision, and strategic goals, encompassing educational content, promotional materials, and digital assets. 2. Content Development: Oversee the creation, curation, and management of high-quality educational content across multiple formats and platforms, ensuring alignment with curriculum standards and pedagogical best practices. 3. Operations Management: Lead the operational functions of the university, including facilities management, resource allocation, budget planning, procurement, and vendor management, to support efficient and effective operations. 4. Team Leadership: Build and lead a high-performing team of content creators, instructional designers, operations managers, and support staff, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence. 5. Strategic Partnerships: Identify and cultivate strategic partnerships and collaborations with external organizations, content providers, technology vendors, and industry leaders to enhance the university's content offerings and operational capabilities. 6. Technology Integration: Drive the integration of technology solutions, including learning management systems (LMS), content authoring tools, and data analytics platforms, to support content delivery, assessment, and analysis. 7. Quality Assurance: Establish and enforce quality assurance processes and standards for content development, operations, and service delivery, ensuring excellence in all aspects of university operations. 8. Performance Monitoring: Develop and implement key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of content initiatives and operational processes, driving continuous improvement and innovation. 9. Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, accreditation standards, and institutional policies and procedures related to content management, operations, and data privacy. 10. Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including faculty, staff, students, administrators, alumni, and community partners, to gather feedback, address needs, and enhance the overall student experience. Qualifications: 1. Masters degree or equivalent in Education, Business Administration, or related field; Doctorate preferred. 2. Minimum of 20 years of progressive leadership experience in content management, operations management, or related field, preferably in higher education or a related industry. 3. Experience in EdTech or online education sector is highly preferred. 4. Demonstrated expertise in content strategy development, curriculum design, instructional design, and educational technology integration. 5. Proven track record of leading and managing complex operations, teams, and projects, with a focus on innovation, efficiency, and excellence. 6. Strong financial acumen and experience in budget planning, resource allocation, and financial management. 7. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. 8. Strategic thinking and problem-solving ability, with a results-oriented mindset and a commitment to continuous improvement. 9. Visionary leadership style, with the ability to inspire and empower teams to achieve ambitious goals and drive organizational success.
column11: Content Strategy, Operations Management, Technology Integration, Content Development, Team Leadership, Strategic Partnerships, Quality Assurance

column1: Senior Technical Writer - Financial  Trading Domain
column2: Position Responsibilities:  The technical writer will:  - liaise with project and product managers to define documentation content  - work closely with developers, QA engineers and other experts worldwide to obtain knowledge and technical information  - write technical and functional guides, incorporate changes and add new information as the products evolve  - structure content using an XML editor  - prepare graphics  - share knowledge and experience with colleagues.  Position Requirements:  Writing skills:  - Ability to understand target audiences and their needs  - ability to translate technical information into simple, concise English  - Ability to adhere to the writing guidelines and review processes  Technical skills:  - experience of structured writing (XML)  - basic IT knowledge (networks, client-server model)  - knowledge of financial markets (front- to back-office)  - knowledge of agile principles is a plus  Personal attributes:  - English speaker  - a good communicator, resourceful, creative, and flexible  - a team player who is also capable of working autonomously  - able to learn quickly and follow instructions  - able to prioritise long-term requirements with short-term objectives
column11: Graphics, Target, Financial markets, XML, Writing skills, Content, Technical skills, Back officeTechnical

column2: The Content Engineer II configures content solutions for P&C core systems processing from moderate to high complexity Agile stories and creates a conceptual design/architecture for configurations solutions using the Duck Creek toolset.         Configures content solutions for moderate to high complexity Agile stories independently and across multiple domain or platform areas.         Reads and interprets high complexity rules and requirements from standards organizations like ISO, NCCI, AAIS, etc         Creates a conceptual design/architecture for medium scale content solutions in collaboration with an architect.         Debugs and resolves high complexity configuration bugs or issues working independently, making sure to find the real root cause and provides a fix without collateral damage.         Writes automated unit and integration-level tests with direction from other team members.         Follows development standards and effectively demonstrate content solutions to other developers in code reviews.         Perform other related duties and activities as required.           Education and Work Experience:           Bachelor of Science degree;    or higher education level, or its foreign equivalent,    preferred in Mathematics, Computer Information Sciences or Busines         Total Work Experience: 10 years minimum, 15+ years (software development),         Leadership Experience: 2 years minimum, 4 years preferred         Product Experience: 6 years minimum, 8+ years preferred         Domain Experience: 6 years minimum, 8+ years preferred               Specialized Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities:       ?       Expert in:           XML/XSLT Document Design         XPath Querying         Insurance Domain Knowledge         Knowledge of Property & Casualty Insurance Lines of Business (Commercial Auto, General Liability, etc)         Expert in 2 Line of Business, proficient in at least 1 other line         Utilize Content Development Standards & Best Practices         Ability to estimate coding efforts         Knowledge of Relational Database Designs & Queries         Understanding of Agile Methodology           Ability to use and/or configure:           EXAMPLE Express          EXAMPLE Server          EXAMPLE Transact          EXAMPLE Author          EXAMPLE Testing Tools and Utilities             Knowledge of Duck Creek Policy or Billing or Claims or Engagement (AP) or Data Insights         Expert in usage of at least one product, aware of the rest         Uses analytical thinking to breakdown and work through situations or problems         Ability to manage time to effectively meet deadlines         Ability to operate independently with minimal guidance           Proficient in:           Technical Writing skills       Source Code Management     Writing high-performance code     Ability to apply Root Cause Analysis during the development cycle     Ability to use and/or configure:     EXAMPLE Platform Extensions     EXAMPLE Platform Features     EXAMPLE User Admin      EXAMPLE Forms        Ability to communicate well within a team environment         Ability to communicate effectively with Customers           Other Requirements:               Travel:      25-50%

column2: Responsibilities Include:    Provide both technical and end user documentation each new system feature or module as   it is developed.    Monitor the existing functionality and updating the documentation to reflect all enhancements   and changes.    Develop and maintain all documentation associated with the process of developing new   components,  features and products as it is a key component of the product development cycle.    Develop and maintain documentation to allow implementation of new components   and features client projects.    Develop and improve methodology delivering information to development staff and end   users.    Understand the systems and products of the Company s customers and provide input to the   corporate technical strategies.    Maintain a common look and feel internal and external company documentation.    Update system documentation as changes are implemented and released.    Manage the document repository all Product development projects.    Support the Company with critical path projects.    Support Management in cultivating revenue - generating with existing clients.    Provide support to the Development Managers and Project Managers by demonstrating   leadership that is in unison with department initiatives and project goals,  objectives and scope.    Job Description   Technical Writer   Own the design documentation all Company products.    Take initiative to broaden and improve skills by participating in educational programs,  seminars,    etc.    Perform research in support of product development objectives.    Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff including technology and product   development teams.    Other duties as assigned.    Professional Qualifications Skills and Abilities Required:    High Level of Analytical Skills  -  a demonstrated ability of effective decision - making and problem solving   skills.
